name: Home Runs A to Z Quiz | MLB Records | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which "A" smacked over 600 home runs?
questions.explanation:
Hank Aaron & Aaron & Henry Aaron.

	755 homeruns.

questions.text: Which 'giant' "B" hit over 700 home runs?
Which of these "C's" hit over 400 home runs?
questions.explanation:
Jose Canseco.

	446 homeruns as of the end of the 2000 season.

questions.text: What letter "D" smacked over 400 with a variety of teams?
Which of the following "E's", hit over 400 home runs?
The letter "F" found what player who hit over 500 big ones?
What "G" fell just short of 500 home runs when he retired?
Which big "H" hit over 350 home runs?
The "I's" have it, with what player who over 200 home runs?
Not known as 'Mr.J', what "J" hit over 500 home runs?
Over 500 home runs belong to which of the following "K's"?
What big "L" hit over 307 home runs?
What player with the "M", hit over 650 home runs?
Which of the following "N's", hit over 350 home runs?
Which of these big "O's", hit over 500 home runs?
"P" for power shows which of these sluggers who hit over 400 home runs?
questions.explanation:
Rafael Palmeiro.

	He hit number 400 on September 23, 2000.

questions.text: "Q" for this question of which player has more career home runs?
questions.explanation:
Mark Quinn.

	Mark Quinn passed Jaime Quirk on May 26th, 2002.

questions.text: What player was the first "R" to hit 300 career home runs?
"S" for Superman, and which of the following players that hit over 500 home runs?
Which of the following "T's" hit over 350 home runs?
questions.explanation:
Frank Thomas.

	'Big Hurt' had 376 at the end of the 2002 season.

questions.text: What "U" was the first to hit 100 career home runs?
Which of these "V's" was the first to hit 350 home runs?
questions.explanation:
Greg Vaughn.

	352 homeruns at of the end of the 2002 season.

questions.text: "W" for war hero also, which of the following was the first to hit 500 home runs?
Which "Y" was the first to hit 400 home runs?
Which "Z" hit over 250 home runs?
questions.explanation:
Todd Zeile.

	Todd Zeile hit 253 home runs.
